ul.li1: 1“But now hear, Jacob my servant,
ul.li2: and Israel, whom I have chosen.
ul.li1: 2Thus says Yahweh, who made you,
ul.li2: and who formed you inOr “from” the womb and will help you:
ul.li1: you must not fear, my servant Jacob,
ul.li2: and Jeshurun whom I have chosen.
ul.li1: 3For I will pour out water on a thirsty land
ul.li2: and streams on dry ground.
ul.li1: I will pour my spirit out on your descendantsHebrew “descendant”
ul.li2: and my blessing on your offspring.
ul.li1: 4And they shall sprout amongLiterally “in between” the grass
ul.li2: like willows by a watercourse of water.
ul.li1: 5This one will say, ‘I belong to Yahweh!’
ul.li2: And that one will be called by the name of Jacob,
ul.li1: and another will write on his hand ‘Yahweh’s’
ul.li2: and take the nameLiterally “he will be titled by the name” of Israel.”

ul.li1: 6Thus says Yahweh, the king of Israel,
ul.li2: and its redeemer, Yahweh of hosts:
ul.li1: “I am the first, and I am the last,
ul.li2: and there is no god besides me.
ul.li1: 7And who is like me? Let him proclaimOr “call” it!
ul.li2: And let him declare it and set it in order for me
ul.li1: since I established an eternal peopleLiterally “from my placing a people of eternity” and things that are to come,
ul.li2: and let them tell them the things that are coming.
ul.li1: 8You must not tremble,Or “be startled”
ul.li2: and you must not be paralyzed with fear.
ul.li1: Have I not made you hear from of oldOr “then”
ul.li2: and declared it, and you are my witnesses?
ul.li1: Is there a god besides me?
ul.li2: And there is no rock! I know none!”

ul.li1: 9All those who form an idol are nothing,
ul.li2: and their delightful things do not profit.
ul.li1: And their witnesses do not see or know,
ul.li2: so they will be ashamed.
10Who would form a god
and cast an image of which he cannot profit?
ul.li1: 11Look! all his companions shall be ashamed,
ul.li2: and the artisans are human!
ul.li1: Let all of them assemble;
ul.li2: let them stand up.
ul.li1: They shall tremble;Or “be startled”
ul.li2: they shall be ashamed together.
ul.li1: 12The ironsmithLiterally “craftsman of iron” works in the coals with his tool
ul.li2: and forms it with hammers.
ul.li1: And he makes it with his strong arm;Literally “the arm of his strength”
ul.li2: indeed, he becomes hungry, and he lacksLiterally “there is no” strength;
he does not drink water, and he is faint.
ul.li1: 13The woodworkerLiterally “craftsman of wood” stretches out a line;
ul.li2: he makes an outline of it with a marker.
ul.li1: He makes it with a knife
ul.li2: and makes an outline of it with a compass.
ul.li1: He makes it like the image of a man,
ul.li2: like the beauty of a human, to dwell in a temple.Or “house”
ul.li1: 14Cutting down cedars for himself,
ul.li2: he choosesLiterally “takes” a holm tree and an oak,
ul.li1: and he lets it grow strong for him among the trees of the forest.
ul.li2: He plants a cedar, and the rain makes it grow.
ul.li1: 15And it becomes fuel for a human,Literally “will become for a man as burning”
ul.li2: and he takes some of it and grows warm;
also, he kindles a fire and bakes bread.
ul.li1: Also, he makes a god and bows in worship;
ul.li2: he makes himself an image and bows down to it!
ul.li1: 16He burns half of it in the fire;
ul.li2: he eats meat over half of it;
he roasts a roast and is satisfied.
ul.li1: Also he grows warm and says, “Ah!
ul.li2: I am warm! I see the fire!”
ul.li1: 17And he makes the remainder of it into a god!
ul.li2: He bows down to his idol,
ul.li1: and he bows in worship and prays to him,
ul.li2: and he says, “Save me, for you are my god!”
ul.li1: 18They do not know,
ul.li2: and they do not understand,
ul.li1: for their eyes are besmeared so that they cannot see,Literally “from seeing”
ul.li2: their mindsLiterally “hearts” so that they have no insight.Literally “from having insight”
ul.li1: 19And no one takes it to heart,Literally “he does not bring back to his heart” and there is no knowledge
ul.li2: and no understanding to say, “I burned half of it in the fire
ul.li1: and also I baked bread on its coals;
ul.li2: I roasted meat, and I have eaten.
ul.li1: And I shall make the rest of it into an abomination!
ul.li2: I shall bow down to a block of wood!”
ul.li1: 20He feeds on ashes; a deceived mindLiterally “heart deceived” misleads him.
ul.li2: And he cannot save himself,Literally “his soul” and he cannot say,
ul.li3: “Is this not an illusion in my right hand?”

ul.li1: 21“Remember these things, Jacob,
ul.li2: and Israel, for you are my servant:
ul.li1: I formed you; you are my servant;
ul.li2: Israel, you will not be forgotten by me!
ul.li1: 22I have wiped your transgressions out like a cloud
ul.li2: and your sins like mist.
ul.li1: Return to me,
ul.li2: for I have redeemed you!”
ul.li1: 23Sing for joy, heavens, for Yahweh has done it!
ul.li2: Shout, depths of the earth!
ul.li1: Break forth, mountains, in rejoicing,
ul.li2: forest and every tree in it,
ul.li1: for Yahweh has redeemed Jacob,
ul.li2: and he will show his glory in Israel!

ul.li1: 24Thus says Yahweh, your redeemer,
ul.li2: and he who formed you inOr “from” the womb:
ul.li1: “I am Yahweh, who made everything,
ul.li2: who stretched out the heavens alone,
who spread out the earth—who was with me?—
ul.li1: 25who frustratesOr “breaks” the signs of oracle priests
ul.li2: and makes a fool of diviners,
ul.li1: who drives the wise men back
ul.li2: and makes their knowledge foolish,
ul.li1: 26who keepsOr “erects” the word of his servant
ul.li2: and carries out the plan of his messengers,
ul.li1: who says of Jerusalem, ‘It shall be inhabited,’
ul.li2: and of the cities of Judah, ‘They shall be rebuilt,
and I will restore its ruins’;
ul.li1: 27who says to the deep, ‘Dry up!
ul.li2: And I will cause your rivers to dry up’;
ul.li1: 28who says of Cyrus, ‘My shepherd,’
ul.li2: and he shall carry out all my wishesHebrew “wish”;
ul.li1: and saying of Jerusalem, ‘It shall be rebuilt,’
ul.li2: and the temple, ‘It shall be founded.’ ”
